{"id":852556535,"question_id":2,"lang":"python3","lang_name":"Python3","time":"2 years, 3 months","timestamp":1669852073,"status":10,"status_display":"Accepted","runtime":"190 ms","url":"/submissions/detail/852556535/","is_pending":"Not Pending","title":"Add Two Numbers","memory":"13.9 MB","code":"# Definition for singly-linked list.\n# class ListNode:\n#     def __init__(self, val=0, next=None):\n#         self.val = val\n#         self.next = next\nclass Solution:\n    def addTwoNumbers(self, l1: Optional[ListNode], l2: Optional[ListNode]) -> Optional[ListNode]:\n        dummy=ListNode()\n        cur=dummy\n        carry=0\n        \n        \n        while l1 or l2 or carry:\n            #here we are storing the linked list value in order to perform addition later one\n            v1=l1.val if l1 else 0\n            v2=l2.val if l2 else 0\n            \n            #once we have independent value we will perform the addition\n            val=v1+v2+carry\n            #checking if the number if greater then 10\n            carry=val//10\n            val=val%10\n            #appending the value in the linked list and creating a link between dummy and the new node\n            cur.next=ListNode(val)\n            \n            #print(cur)\n            \n            #updating the pointers\n            l1=l1.next if l1 else None\n            l2=l2.next if l2 else None\n            cur=cur.next\n            \n        return dummy.next\n            \n            ","compare_result":"","title_slug":"add-two-numbers","has_notes":false,"flag_type":1}
